text.text_translated: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids (PHAs) are space rocks that could be dangerous, because they can pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has made a map of 1,400 PHAs, and none of them are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology that already exists, NASA can track these objects and predict if an impact might happen, and if that time comes, two defence options could be launched.
